definitions.definition: A universal antidote against all poisons , particularly medicines considered to derive from a recipe of the Roman physician Andromachus and representing an improvement on mithridate .
examples: Theriac was essentially homeopathic in its supposed function, being an improvement on mithridate by virtue of containing more poisons.

definitions.definition: Synonym of antidote , particularly ( pseudoscience ) those incorporating snakemeat to cure snakebite .

main_definition: ( pharmacology , historical ) A universal antidote against all poisons , particularly medicines considered to derive from a recipe of the Roman physician Andromachus and representing an improvement on mithridate .
secondary_definitions: ( pharmacology , archaic ) Synonym of antidote , particularly ( pseudoscience ) those incorporating snakemeat to cure snakebite .
